No-huddle is quick and to the point(s)

(Jim Davis/Globe Staff)
Speed is the key to running the no-huddle offense, which the Patriots used to amass 31 points and a franchise-record 35 first downs over the Broncos on Sunday. (Globe)

Upper Crust pizza files for bankruptcy

The Boston-based gourmet pizza chain that expanded rapidly over the last decade but recently struggled with labor troubles, financial problems, and ownership disputes owes at least $3.4 million in bills. (Boston Globe)

Man injured in 2003 R.I. nightclub fire gets hand transplant at Mass. General Hospital

Joe Kinan, who was injured in The Station nightclub fire, is recovering after receiving a new left hand in the first surgery of its kind at the Boston hospital. (Globe)

Raw meat diet for your pet

Raw diets include the whole animal, including organs and ground bone. They can be served in carcass form or ground up and formed into patties.
